title: Old-fashioned elegance
review: My wife and I spent two nights here and loved the old fashioned elegance and ambience of this hotel. Excellent service and facilities which included the saunas and swimming pool. A breakfast choice to suit all. Our room was well equipped and with clean modern facilities. Overall exceptional value for money. Mid range price but luxury facilities

title: Very well run hotel
review: Booked through Travel Department and had a great week. This hotel has excellent facilities, the pool and spa is superb. All staff are friendly and helpful, you really get the feel that they love working there and are a credit to their employers. The buffet breakfast is fabulous from selection to quality and waiting staff deserve a big thank you. However top marks must go to the team of chefs who created dishes each night which were both inventive and presented skilfully. As someone who has been in the hotel business for nearly 20yrs. praise is not given lightly. Thanks again.

title: late Summer
review: I stayed in this exceptional hotel with a party from Buckleys, Doncaster.The hotel built in 1910 has maintained a lot of its original features.The rooms were spacious and the bathrooms were very good.Very quiet considering it wa near two main roads into town centre.The food was of high quality catering for dinner and there was plenty of choices.for breakfast.The staff looked after us very well nothing was too much trouble and they dressed immaculate in suits,white shirts and dickie bow ties. Good to see the hotel had a dress code.All in all one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in.

title: Perfect place perfect service
review: Beautiful place, kind staff, good food. Modern rooms, perfect beds for a good rest.  Near downtown ... walking distance to the lake and to the city center.  What I liked the most was the energy... I was alone for business, tired didn’t feel like going out so I decided to visit the restaurant.  Full room you can feel the good energy, people laughing and having fun.  100%recommended!!

title: Super hotel
review: We stayed in the Liberty hotel for a week with the travel dept. Lovely hotel and a brilliant tour guide Renata she is a credit to her profession very knowledgable .the breakfast was very good a great selection of fruit and cheeses and ham ....also hot items....I would highly recommend this hotel ..the rooms were lovely ,beds very comfortable and a super bathroom

title: Grand indeed!
review: I’ve just returned from a week with The Travel Department staying in the Grand Hotel Liberty. It’s in an excellent location, a few minutes stroll to the lakeside & main shopping area. The hotel really lives up to its name! It’s a beautiful building with a touch of old class. The room I stayed in was on the first floor. It was quiet & spacious. It was cleaned every day & new sheets on the beds appeared daily as well as clean towels.  It’s a very decorative hotel with plenty of seating areas. I didn’t use the spa but some others on the trip did. The outside swimming pool is a pretty area, even just to sit by. The food is truly exceptional. Breakfast was an array of fruit, dairy, cereals, breads, cakes etc. The evening meals were really fine dining! On one evening we were treated…

title: Very grand but some points you should know
review: A very grand hotel dating back to 1910 beautiful setting with mountain views,very ornate setting for the pool. Breakfast is self service,but has everything you would want,chef on hand to cook your eggs,omelettes, or crepes. If you come as part of a package  deal the coach will not drop you off outside the hotel,but drops you off about 150 yards away. Hotel is a short distance from the old tow n centre,plenty of bars restaurants, and shops,as well as harbour for boat trips on the lake. If you are over 65 go to tourist information office and ask for discount card for boat trips. Ask your rep or hotel staff for best deals on boats as it can be confusing,but remember to check timetable for the boat back.

title: Love the opulence
review: A grand hotel from 1910 in need of a lick of paint but, my gosh, it has style. Perfect service from professional staff. A stone's throw from old Riva town. We were blessed with room 103 which was grand and has the grandest of balconies at the front of the hotel which has the sun all day long.

title: Fab hotel, great location
review: We stayed for six nights in the GHL and couldn’t fault it. The dining room staff in particular were so warm and friendly.  Breakfast: large continental breakfast selection as well as bacon and eggs etc. there is also a crepe and omelette chef. Coffee was a bit hit and miss so we ordered cappuccinos to be on safe side.   Dinner: our package was half board. This includes a salad, starter, main and dessert. The menu is European and quite high brow - stunning food and generous portions. A couple of nights we didn’t fancy anything not the menu and the staff and chef couldn’t have been more accommodating offering alternatives such as steak or chicken.   Outdoor pool: lovely and quiet but beware the mozzies!! Our advice is wear repellant and don’t sit out after 3pm. We learned the…

title: 2nd Visit to Grand Hotel Liberty - Brilliant Experience yet again !!!
review: This was my 2nd time staying in Grand Hotel Liberty in the town of Riva Del Garda. It was yet again a great experience. From efficient check in to Beautiful food and a superb location, it just ticks all the boxes. The room was spotless clean and very modern as we stayed in the newly renovated section of the hotel and we had no issues or problems all week. I must mention the new staff in the restaurant who looked like they were being trained. They were immaculately dressed and really attentive to each table, I think they did really well and we were happy with their service. All in all I will be back again in the future to stay in Riva and the Grand Hotel Liberty. We were very satisfied with our stay. Thank You !

title: Fabulous hotel in central location
review: A beautiful hotel for our 2 night stay. We had a top floor room which was very well furnished with excellent shower room and air conditioning. The on-site parking was a priority for us. The breakfast was lovely, plenty of choice and high quality. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Definitely would return when next in Italy

title: Bonjourno
review: Lovely hotel, beautiful view of the mountains and open waters. Continental breakfast is standard. Nothing wow about it. Have a nice pool with good spa facilities.  Friendly customer service. Thumbs up....

title: Fabulous!!
review: Just returned (16/7/19) from 7 night stay (with the Travel Department).   This is a fabulous hotel in an excellent location for all the amenities of Riva Del Garda. Staff are very friendly and helpful and can communicate in English. The room that we stayed in was new and spotless though a little small but with a huge bed. The room had Irish/UK 3 pin plugs so no need for adapters (there is also a USB connection incorporated in the plug). An easy to operate electronic safe with an internal plug is included with the room. The hotel is fully air conditioned and has external shutters operated by a touch panel beside the bed. Two tiny points: (a)why only one key card per room ? and (b) for tour packages  why do guests have to choose what they want for dinner at breakfast time? Highly…

title: Great until last night
review: This hotel has great facilities , friendly staff and nice food. They give you a safe key without you having to rent it which I thought was a nice touch.  There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room though.  I was prepared to give this a 5/5 rating, however I am currently wide awake at 23:15 on our last night with a 5am wake up time to catch our flight, because they have some live music show going on right outside our room. It is sooooooo loud even with ear plugs in. It is completely unreasonable and inconsiderate  to play loud music at this time of night. I appreciate they are putting on entertainment for guests that dont have to get up early on a saturday morning, but it's a bit of a f*** you to those that do. I complained at the desk and the poor man said I was not…

title: Nice modernised 1910 hotel
review: I liked this hotel. Very close to the harbour and restaurants and shops (5 minutes). Modernised from 1910 with many turn of the century rooms, tiles, ceilings and fittings. I was in a new modern room at the rear. Excellent breakfast. Only down point was the limited, tight car parking. Enter the car park by the sliding gate on the right - it opens automatically. Parked first then registered at reception.

title: Very good 4 star hotel
review: We stayed for week, travelling with Travel Department. Hotel is in great central location to everything. Old style exterior mixed with modern interior. Very clean, very pleasant staff.  You have to pick your dinner choice at breakfast. While food was good it was sometimes too fine dining for everyone but they are obliging if u ask.

title: Visit to Lake Garda
review: Went to Lake Garda, Venice & Verona on 7 night package with the Travel Department. Stayed in the Grand Hotel Liberty.  The hotel was excellent, lovely room on the 3rd floor.  Breakfast and evening meal were very good. The location of the hotel is very good.  Verona is  a lovely place, it was raining all day on our tour of Venice which was very busy.  We also did an optional excursion to the Italian Alps which would have been great except it rained all day that day.  The half day guided excursion on Lake Garda was beautiful.

title: Great hotel - Great location!
review: *Beautifully decorated large room at the front of the hotel - surprisingly quiet as we were on the main road.  Super king sized bed - just like home.  Lots of storage space. *Great location for centre of Riva - 2 minutes walk! *Breakfast plentiful and varied.  Cold plates for hot breakfast food - but hey not everything's perfect. *All staff - very friendly, professional and helpful. *Indoor pool - hotel bathrobes and towels had to be purchased/hired, to use this facility.

title: Very, Very Good.
review: Hello Everybody                             I am bit late with this anyway, I visited Lake Garda last November 2018 with the Travel Department(more later about Travel Dept) first of all I fell in love with Lake Garda , the Lake , the mountains, the people of Riva Del Garda were breathtaking. I heard so much about Lake Garda before my trip and it live up to all my expectations. As for the Grand Hotel Liberty it was great , the staff ,the food , the pool etc were super. The hotel was very, very clean, you could eat your dinner off the floor !!!  Gripes--the rooms could be small bit bigger and one thing I found strange at the time before you could use the pool , sauna etc you had to pay 15 euros to reception and in return you got white Bathrobe., that's the first time I ever to pay…

title: Just arrived and already so pleased
review: I hope my review will stay relevant till the end of the stay but I had to say good things after what just happened. We booked the suite without noticing there are 2 floors and since we are with a young toddler it was a bit scary with all the stairs. My husband asked to move to a regular room and was immidiately replied that we can move without any issues. We just want to say thank you and how much we appreciate it 😊

title: Lovely hotel & very good location
review: We stayed at the liberty in UK school Easter holidays. Lovely hotel glad we booked one of the family suites as this was perfect for us with lots of room and very modern.  Shame that the children are only allowed in the indoor pool until 12pm every day as the pool was not really busy after this time anyway so was a shame to be restricted especially when it was not warm enough for the outdoor pool. Breakfast is OK, the poor guy doing crepes and omelettes could do with some help as it was taking so long when restaurant was busy so you hardly get to spend time eating with your family if you queue for one!!   Lights out in the restaurant at 10am made us feel a bit rushed too as it was like they were urging you to leave.... Head waiter I do have to commend though always friendly and…

title: Good as a package tour experience
review: Stayed here in March as part of a Travel Dept. tour and while tour hotels can be hit and miss I would stay here again if visiting Riva . Nice hotel but go for the refurbished rooms and if possible one with a balcony . Food was OK , nothing special and if the dinner was not included in the Travel Dept package I would definitely have eaten out after the first night , The dinner menu had to be selected at breakfast each morning , quite a delay between courses and the main course was tiny most evenings , not a great experience and oeverall I would put the food at a 4 out of 10 . Staff were also OK and again no great effort on their part . As a package hotel Liberty was fine , great location but eat out .

title: Very clean
review: We stayed here for two nights. The room was so big and also the bed . It was very clean and the bathroom also.  The breakfast had plenty of choice . The waiting staff quickly brought your tea or coffee.  A good hotel with great amenities. Didn’t try the spa or sauna .  Would definitely return here

title: Travel department Lake Garda trip...amazing!!!!
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your reply, we are thinking why you were so happy about all and you didn't give us 4/5 stars ?  Have a nice day and see you again

title: Wonderful Hotel
review: Stayed here in March with family.  Sinead from the Travel department was lovely.  Dining staff were absolutely superb....especially Bruno who was so attentive to my gluten free diet...so helpful and nothing was a problem to change on the menu.  Choice of food was excellent and service was so professional and friendly..thank you Barbara too and the manager..sorry I forget  name.  Excellent location in a stunning town Riva which needs time to be explored and enjoyed. Stayed in a recently renovated room..showers were heavenly.  Nice time to go in March as weather in pleasant and there is no crowds.  Reception staff lovely and helpful too. Enjoyed siting back with book and Aperol Spritz and olives in the bar after a day of touring.  I cannot say enough about our guide RENATE...she…

title: Summer 2018
review: We stayed at Grande Hotel Liberty at the end of July 2018. We have stayed before at this family owned 4 star hotel. It is without doubt the best hotel to stay at in Riva del Garda. There is a choice of old traditional rooms or modern refurbished rooms. We stayed in the old traditional part of the hotel. The room we had was superb, maid service was excellent and all the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The reception staff couldn't do enough for you, the dining room was excellent and the again the staff were helpful and friendly, nothing was too much trouble and the food was traditional Italian with cooked and served beautifully. The hotel bar was excellent and the drinks were really reasonably priced and good value.  The hotel is in a wonderful position, the pool…

title: Great base for Riva visit
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your stay and choice on our hotel !  Hope to see you again in the near future  Wish you a nice day

title: Renovation 0verdue
review: Arrived as part of Travel Dept tour and wasn’t expecting such a quality hotel! We were given one of the recently renovated rooms and it was excellent. Lovely decor, comfortable bed, beautiful bathroom, sensor controlled pad on the wall controlling lights, shutters etc. Nice view from the balcony which was added to by the fine sunny weather!Half board option suited most people but I personally found the choice limited and not to my taste. A slightly fuller menu would improve things vastly. The staff and overall service were both excellent and couldn’t be faulted. Overall, I would recommend this hotel highly and if/when we do return to Riva we would love to stay in Hotel Grand Liberty again 👍

title: Centrally located in Riva del Garda

title: Nice hotel
review: Located on one of the main access roads to Riva, the hotel is easy to find. As it is quite central, Riva can be explored on foot. The hotel has a massive parking lot problem, as the number of places is by far not enough for the size of the house; moreover, the available spaces are cramped. As a result, you usually must park your car at a public parking place which is 300 m away and not guarded. At check-in and checkout, the car must be parked on the sidewalk. A suitcase ramp is missing. We had booked a superior room. This was on the 2nd floor. You could see the town and Lake Garda in the distance. The room was not well heated and a complaint in this respect led to no improvement. The reason for the relatively low room temperature were probably the completely dilapidated, leaking…

title: A Great Hotel in a Great Location
review: Stayed at this hotel for a week on the third floor......lovely room clean and big comfortable bed.  Food first class and staff very helpful. Hotel located in centre of town and only a short walk to lake with its picturesque views!  This 4* star hotel is highly recommended

title: Great location
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your review !  Hope to see you again in the future !

title: Lovely hotel in perfect location.
review: We stayed here as part of an escorted tour group on a half-board basis.  The hotel is well located for a stroll into town to visit the local bars/restaurants, and a walk to the lakeside takes about 5 minutes.  There is a supermarket around the corner from the hotel and there is a pharmacy close by too.    We were luckily designated one of the recently refurbished rooms at the back of the hotel, which overlooked the outdoor pool area.  The in-room technology (touch-screen lighting/AC control centers) was quite unexpected as the front part of the hotel (and the rooms situated there) is in the Art Nouveau style.  While the mattress was comfortable, the star of the show was the excellent air-conditioning which allowed us to enjoy a decent sleep during Lucifer's heatwave! The…

title: Grande liberty hotel
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your review ! We take notes of your reports regarding staff, thanks !  Hope to see you again in the future !

title: A special place
review: Just returned from Grand Liberty after a week organised by the Travel Department. The hotel was lovely, but our room was a bit on the small side and we didn’t have a great view. Balcony rooms are available at an extra charge. We were on the third floor in the new wing. Some building work was going on but it didn’t bother us as we were out most of the day. Housekeeping was excellent, the rooms were kept spotless.  The staff were pleasant throughout the hotel, but the staff in the dining room were a lot more friendly. Special thanks to Antonio and Tino who were exceptional, they were more relaxed and very funny. The food was lovely with plenty of choice and it was no bother to have anything changed if not to your liking.  The hotel in is the perfect location just a short walk to…

title: A very well managed and relaxing hotel
review: The hotel is in two halves: new and old. We stayed in the older section which was of a classic style. The room was spacious and comfortable with a substantial balcony overlooking the pool area. The dining room was organised well and the food was of a high standard. We especially enjoyed the omolette chef at breakfast. The hotel is perfectly situated with a short walk to the lake shore and the main plaza where you can access lots of great restaurants and bars. Riva is a beautiful place with lots to offer especially with regards to cycling, wind surfing, paddle boarding or simply relaxing.

title: Elegant hotel
review: Good afternoon,  hoping to see you again, we wish you a nice day and an happy new year !

title: Cracking hotel
review: My husband and I stayed here as part of a group in sept . We were very pleased with the hotel , fast smooth check in , our room was in the new end , very modern, spotless and lovely and quiet just what we wanted. The hotel is in the perfect position,a few minutes walk from the town square and from the lake .there are lots of nice restaurants in the town although we were on half board in the hotel and the food was very good . There is a walking and cycling track down by the lake , absolutely fabulous, rent a bike and head off , no traffic and it goes on forever. We enjoyed coming back to the indoor pool in the evening for a relax before dinner, I know there is a charge of €30 but that covers the week and we felt it was worth it .  We will definitely be back to Riva again and will…

title: Beautiful hotel with top service with great staff and great location .
review: This is a very regal hotel on entering but has the modern touches also.  The staff are excellent. The rooms are very clean and the pool is beautiful. There is also an amazing spa if you feel the need. The breakfast is excellent with lots of choices. Dinner was good also

title: Excellent Hotel in a Perfecto Location!!
review: Love this Hotel. This was our 4th stay at the Hotel in as many years. Could not complain in any way about this Hotel, its staff, facilities and location. It is perfectly placed less than five minutes meander from the old town of Riva and from the Lake itself. We stayed in one of the newly revamped attic rooms, which had all the mod cons. Excellent new modern decor, air conditioning and mini fridge. The room, as was the rest of the Hotel, was spotlessly clean. The super friendly staff were as welcoming as ever and couldn't do enough for you. The breakfast choices also seem to have been revamped, with a better choice of hot food, such as freshly made omelettes and crepes. They also offer a wide range of continental breakfast items, including gluten free alternatives, fresh coffees…

title: The most wonderful holiday
review: Good afternoon Rosemary,  nice to read your review and that you enjoyed your stay with us ! We look forward to see you again next year !  Thanks

title: Great hotel great location
review: My husband and I have just returned from a ten night stay at the Liberty and what a treat it was! The hotel is absolutely beautiful with its old style glamour and it was kept immaculate at all times. We had one of the modern rooms which was very comfortable and had a great shower. The food was wonderful and we enjoyed being adventurous and trying out different things to what we would normally eat. If you didn’t like something on the menu the staff were very accommodating and would offer to cook you something else. All of the dining staff were really great. We would especially like to say a big thanks to Hakim who looked after us and was such a genuine, sweet guy and also to Morris who also looked after us and amazed us with his passion and knowledge of all the local wines.  If…

title: Stayed here on a partial board basis
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your holiday and your review ! Hope to see you again in the future !

title: They make you feel special!
review: We stayed in hotel for 2 nights. Check in was quick and friendly. The room was nice, but it was an attic room which only had a high window so no view. On my booking it said comfort penthouse, I didn’t realise it was an attic room unfortunately. It was very clean throughout. Spa and pool facilities where excellent. Breakfast was also very good. The location was great, only a few minutes walk away from the town centre and the hotel also offers free parking. Would recommend and I definitely would stay here again.

title: Fantastic staff
review: I stayed at this hotel as part of a Travel Department group. The best thing about the hotel was the staff-especially those in the dining room. They were so helpful, friendly, accommodating and fun! A special mention to Simon, Antonio, Frank and Hakem. When I didn't like the main course options they made sure I received something I would like. There was always a smile!  The hotel is lovely and in an excellent location, close to the old town and a supermarket and has a lovely pool which I used daily. My only difficulty was the air conditioner in the room. It was controlled by reception and I had to ask several times to make it colder as the room wasn't as cool as it needed to be for the heat! Buy staff were always attentive.

title: Old fashioned elegance
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your review, will pass this at our staff !  See you again

title: Another wonderful visit to Grand Hotel Liberty
review: Perfect location, rooms were small but very clean, reception staff excellent, restaurant staff not very friendly, breakfast fresh and plentiful. Diva is fantastic for walking and cycling, old town is very quirky.

title: Great Hotel
review: Good afternoon !  Thanks a lot for your review ! See you in the future

title: Helen M
review: Firstly...Riva Del Garda is a dream with something for everyone to do and enjoy, from sitting relaxing and reading a book under the shade of a tree to seriously epic biking routes, boat rides, train rides. Just put it on your next travel plans!! 10 star rating *****  Now then, the hotel  Grand Hotel Liberty.....5 star treatment and friendliness. I can not emphasize enough, IMHO... how amazing this hotel is and how it continues to attract me back time and time again. There have been some changes, the old rooms on the ground floor to the back section of the hotel have had a makeover, functional, clean and beside the pool. For me, the enchanting beauty of the main part of the hotel is delightful. Staying in room 209 during very hot weather was a real treat, air conditioning a joy…

title: Absolutely Beautiful Hotel
review: My Partner and I have just returned from a trip to Lake Garda with the Travel Department. We stayed half board in the Grand Liberty Hotel.  The Hotel was lovely. We stayed in the new part of the hotel and the room had all the mod cons you would expect for a hotel of this standard.  Some people stayed in the older part and they didn't have air conditioning, so I would say to potential travellers that if you are booking this hotel to request  a room in the new part of the hotel.  The food and the staff were brilliant and everybody's taste in food was accommodated.  Some of the travellers in our group had special dietary needs (i.e. diabetic, coeliac) and they let the hotel know in advance and they were accommodated in this regard. The hotel is right in the centre of Riva del Garda…

title: Great week.
review: Fantastic hotel. Lovely setting and surroundings. The room was spotless and had all mod cons. The pool area was lovely, too. Just needed some more sun beds. The BIG let down was the staff. Apart from the happy cleaners and the head waiter, they were rather morose and unfriendly. One particular waiter at breakfast asked if my wife wanted his jacket when she moved a plate onto the table! All in all, a great stay but the staff definitely need PR training. Such a shame or it would be 5⭐️.

title: Beautiful hotel but let down by appalling staff
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot ! We will take care about your review and will speak with  the staff

title: Pleasant enough, but not perfect
review: Had a wonderful week in this hotel .The staff were excellent .Reception were friendly ,helpful, and attentive...as were the dining room waiters who made us feel comfortable from the moment we entered the dining room always with a friendly smile and a "buongiorno" greeting !  Always had time to explain the menu or suggest a good wine ..well done to them all. Our room was classed as a superior and was an amazing size including a small balcony and  was kept immaculate for the duration of our stay . One very small niggle was the lack of a shower ..we had a bath only...with a very short low hand held hose/shower attatchment for maybe rinsing your hair in the bath . Astonishing ommision for a superior room .This aside we would recommend the Hotel 100% . Classy comfortable feel to the…

title: Excellent hotel
review: Visited in April. Hotel was excellent. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I’m gluten free and they went out of their way to accommodate my needs- which is certainly not always the case. The rooms were comfy and modern but maybe s little warm. The weather was exceptionally warm fog the time of year. The central location close to town centre was so convenient but yet hotel was quiet and peaceful. Would definitely recommend.

title: "Lovely April Break"
review: April, weather gorgeous, first trip with Travel Department. Two Coeliac's in the group of nine. I don't know where to start! For breakfast there was a varied choice of fruit, yogurt,  cheese, meats, scrambled eggs, bacon, gluten free cornflakes, gf bread rolls, omelettes made to your taste but best of all for me, GF PANCAKES. Happy Days. Also individually wrapped muffins, cakes and crackers. Dinner had to be ordered before leaving breakfast, which was great except half of us couldn't remember what we ordered when we arrived back!! Dinners were divine. Presentation was wonderful, flavour's divine, portion's just right. I got a different dessert every night and twice i got two desserts :). I would recommend this Hotel to Coeliac's everywhere. As regards housekeeping, Spotless does…

title: Wonderful
review: Good afternoon  thanks a lot for your wonderful review and waiting to see you agian we wish you a nice summer

title: A pleasant surprise !
review: We have just returned from a 4 night stay and can recommend the Grand Hotel Liberty most highly. We had a spacious modern refurbished room on the ground floor overlooking the pool and the standard of cleanliness in both the room and shower room was very good. The main areas of the hotel are very elegantly styled and its location only a 5 minute walk from the lake and the town centre shops and restaurants is ideal. Breakfast, which we chose to take on the terrace, is self-service with an excellent choice of food on offer. We would recommend the hotel to anyone wishing to spend time in Riva Del Garda.

title: December visit
review: Stayed here for 5 nights in December. We were in one of the newer rooms,big & spacious, very clean but maybe a little to modern for our taste. Staff friendly and food ok. The area was very quiet but this was because it was out of season. Over all no complaints

title: 3 night break
review: Good afternoon and thanks a lot !  Our refurbished area is in a modern style, we still keep our main building in Liberty style if someone prefer. On request you can be allocated in the old or the new area.  Thanks a lot !

title: Nice Hotel with great location and lovely staff
review: We have recently returned from a  3 night stay at the grand hotel liberty. This 2as our first stay in lake Garda and would highly recommend the location. Shops, bars and restaurants are all in close walking distance from the hotel. Unfortunately due to the time of our stay, a number of the restaurants and bars where not open, however, we found a few that we enjoyed during our stay. The hotel is in a great location, although slightly dated, it is suited to the area. The whole hotel was clean and presents itself very well. The staff were pleasnt and helpful. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. Breakfast was varied and offered continental and hot option, such as scrambled eggs and bacon. Our room was basic and in one of the rooms that’s not been refurbished. Although quite…

review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your stay !  Waiting to see you again, thanks a lot

title: Cold Christmas break in this hotel
review: Stayed here half board for a week in early March. As this was the start of the season it was quiet in Riva and a lot of shops were still closed. However it is a nice town to wander around and the walk so around the lake are fabulous. The hotel is sell situated in the middle of the town. For €15 you can get unlimited access to the spa which comes with a robe and towel for the week. The staff in the hotel are very friendly. We stayed in room 221 in the new part of the hotel. It was very modern. Nice firm bed, big bathroom with a good shower. Small balcony overlooking the pool and lovely views of the mountains. Breakfast is good with a selection of cereal, fruit and bacon and eggs. Dinner is OK. I found the food a little under seasoned. All perfectly edible but lacking on real…

title: Great spot
review: Stayed here for 1 week. Lovely hotel very comfortable and central for town and views of the north of the lake. We also visted Varona (1hour) and Venice (2hours) from here. Service was very good.  Food good very Italian. Alcohal expensive but good pub accross the road half price. Really enjoyed it thanks guy's.

title: Fabulous Classic Traditional Hotel
review: Grand hotel Liberty is an amazing hotel in  Riva del Garda. Food is fantastic and staff are very friendly I have been here a few times love Lake Garda . Their are beautiful walks around the lake stunning views beautiful cafes and restaurants

title: Classy hotel
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for the nice review and have a nice day

title: Tourist Hotel
review: A lovely traditional hotel with a fabulous location - less than a 3 minute walk from Lake Garda. Reception check in was a quick and smooth process. I stayed in a new bedroom, nice and warm with all facilities. A superb shower and a lovely cosy bed.I was on the ground floor so no view. also on the corridor was a public toilet - so there was a certain level of noise from the bar and the public toilet each evening. Bar staff were really nice and friendly. Bar was nice and cosy. the dining room was nice, staff were friendly but at times seemed a bit stressed. The quality of food was really good. It has a good bar, two pools and a wellness suite. The only downside was the lack of English tv channels, although we weren't In the room too often. Overall a good Italian four star hotel.

title: Beautiful Hotel

It is convenient for catching buses to pretty well everywhere in this area and beyond. The hotel has free WiFi  but one can have an upgrade for faster service for a fee.

review: Stayed for a week here and the biggest complaint from our group was the TOTAL lack of heat. I kid you not!  If your robe for the pool got wet (robes were compulsory and cost €15) you would have to pay another €15 to get a dry robe.  Lost/mislaid room swipe cards cost €5 to be replaced.  The new rooms are very nice but the bathrooms all need shelves as there is absolutely no place to put toiletries etc.  Wifi very good and state of the art lighting in the room.  Bathroom has a rain forest walkin shower.  Food overall was very good.

This was lovely, however, be aware that there may be noise from the Terrace late at night so if you are a person who likes an early night be aware of this. It didn't cause us any issue - there was a wedding on one of the nights and the music was turned down very low so wasn't a major issue.  Breakfast had a varied array of food, something for everyone. We had dinner there each night and it was lovely. A couple f nights we asked for something off menu and it wasn't a problem.…

title: Step back in time in this charming hotel
review: We only stayed one night at Grand Hotel Liberty during a road trip, but, having seen it, I would like to come back one day for a longer stay. The hotel is very charming and gives one the impression of being on holiday in the early part of the 1900s, when guests would get to know each other during their stay. The breakfast had excellent buffet options. From the hotel the center of Riva del Garda is reached within minutes. Definitely would have liked to stay longer!

title: Location, location, location!!
review: Good afternoon,  thanks for your stay and your comment !  Waiting to see you again for a longer stay, I wish you a nice day !

title: Grand Hotel Liberty, Riva Del Garda
review: Stayed here recently on a holiday with the Travel Department. Riva is a lovely town and the hotel is in a great location on the edge of the town, within walking distance of all the shops, restaurants, cafes and a very short walk will bring you to the beautiful lakeside. Excellent buffet breakfast with a wide selection on offer. The staff were very accommodating in providing Glutenfree products on request as I am a coeliac. Dinner was lovely with a few choices of each course available each night. I thought that the wines were expensive, considering that wine is produced locally. The hotel has some nice relaxing seated areas. The bedrooms could do with some refurbishment but, in such a beautiful location as Lake Garda we didn't spend time in our room. Rooms were clean and…

title: 10 day stay
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot !  See you again next time if  you come to Riva !

title: Overpriced, outdated, not friendly
review: We stayed in Hotel Liberty from Aug. 23-30th 2016 while on holiday with the Travel Department.  The hotel is very convenient to the lake, bus stops, supermarket and shops in general.  My husband and I arranged to go to an opera in Verona and were able to get a mini bus just a short distance from the hotel and were returned to the hotel after the opera.  From very near the hotel we got a bus to Trent and visited the new natural history museum there and also the Diocesan museum where we saw a number of tapestries which hung on the walls of the room where the Council of Trent was held in the 16th century.   At the end of August each year there are fireworks by the lake in Riva Del Garda which are spectacular.   Grand  Hotel Liberty is old and has character.The staff are friendly…

title: Excellent hotel in a great location
review: Stayed here with the Travel Department for a week.  The hotel is old, but that adds to the charm.  A balcony would have been nice but aside from that we had no complaints about the rooms, which were spotless. Beds were comfortable, with extra pillows/blankets if required. The staff in the restaurant were superb, and happy to cater for all needs (dairy free etc).  I had read some complaints about the food before we went but there was an excellent selection of Italian food to choose from and we were never disappointed.  The pool was lovely, though we did not spend much time there as there was so much to do in the vicinity.  Minutes walk to the harbour, lovely shops, cafés etc.

title: Hotel Liberty Riva Del Garda
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your review ! See you again in the future !

title: great location
review: Stayed for a week as part of travel department trip. The room initially allocated was on the 3rd floor and could only be described as a cell. On complaining was immediately offered a better room. Obviously they gave the worst room to see if we would complain - this is nasty. The evening meals from the "special" menu were terrible. Italian is my favourite food so its not like I wanted bacon and cabbage. Non TD diners had a completely different menu in another section of the dinning room. Can you imagine getting "hard" pasta on a regular basis in a quality Italian restaurant. A main course of 4 small (1 cubic centimetre each) chunks of "white fish" is a quality dish. However we discovered on the last day that if you complained you were immediately offered a decent dish like a…

title: Great Hotel Great Location !
review: Good afternoon,  that is not true that we give the worst room, we give the rooms that we have free at that time, and sorry but the weeks in august in Riva del Garda and Lake Garda, are always fully booked. We always give our best possibility to our Guests.  All Guest have same menu, all time time, all the year, so please don't say something wrong. Of course we give always a choice if you don't like something.  Thanks

title: Very grand hotel
review: The foyer is very pleasant as is the dining room & the bars but the rest of the hotel needs attention. Carpets are shabby & bedrooms need up grading too. Outside pool area is excellent. I only came across one or two friendly gents at reception, found the ladies not pleasant or very helpful. Breakfast was average as was dinner for a 4* hotel. The staff in the dining room were very friendly & helpful & tried their best to accommodate when food was not to our liking. The location is excellent just minutes from the old town, however next time I go to Rivava I'll choose a different hotelR

title: Fantastic Holiday
review: Just returned from a brilliant week in this hotel as part of a Travel Department Tour. Have to say, from check-in until we got on the plane home, it was absolutely top class!!!! Staff in the hotel were amazing- friendly, accommodating-& nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was everything we expected from a Grand old building- full of character & history, but spotless & still had the mod cons like the air conditioning  ( which we were very thankful for)☺. Our package was half board & the standard was excellent, plenty of choice &  if you wanted, you could request anything you wanted like steak or chicken, if the menu on any particular evening did not suit you- as I mentioned, nothing was too much trouble. The trips included in the package were excellent & a special mention for…

title: Good Base for a stay in Riva
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your review and your stay !  Hope to see you again !

title: Lovely Italian hotel in town centre
review: Stayed here for 7 nights as part of a Travel Department Trip. Overall impressions were very good. Hotel is nicely situated in Riva, close to the main square. Staff were incredibly friendly. Our hotel room was very spacious and the air conditioning worked brilliantly. Windows were small however as we were in top floor (attic) rooms. Breakfast was a buffet with a wide range of options. Our package was half board so dinner was included. This was a hit and miss depending on the choices offered on the night. The only negative I would have, is that there was a non - refunded charge of €15 per person for use of the indoor pool. With this you are provided with ONE robe and towel to use for the duration of your stay. As there is no changing facilities guests are required to change into…

title: Gone downhill from last year..
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your stay ! You were allocated in a standard room on the 3rd floor, TD Guest don't have attic rooms. We can think of changing a towel and bathrobe every day, but this cannot me made for a price of Euro 15,00. But we will think if we can have a solution.  Thanks

title: Great Staff
review: I was a little bit worried about this hotel as I had read a few negative reviews. I tried to book a room upgrade but couldn't as they were fully booked- I was very glad as the standard room allocated was lovely and overlooking the pool. Granted- the furniture in the rooms isn't a modern style but if you want to stay in a soul-less chain hotel with standardised modern furniture then do that.  We were half board, the breakfast was good and although when presented with a menu everyday I was always a little unsure about the choices, I always ended up really enjoying the meals. The waiting staff were the best and nothing was too much trouble. If you are getting evening meals- please remember that you will be served traditional Italian meals which aren't spaghetti Bol and pizza -…

title: Fabulous experience.
review: The room was average in size with a view overlooking the outdoor pool. It is important that the bed and room temperature are comfortable to allow for a good night sleep - this was most definitely the case. The bed was extremely comfortable and the air-con was silent and worked at keeping the room temperature to my desired level. Room management - bed made, room cleaned etc. was of a high standard each day.   Breakfast and evening dinner were very well prepared and presented and the staff were very professional and best of all they have a great sense of humour - very welcome indeed. I must mention George,Kannan and Dominic - outstanding staff.  The Liberty hotel is indeed a grand hotel that certainly added to making the trip to Riva del Garda a most relaxing and memorable holiday…

title: 1 week stay at Grand Hotel Liberty
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a million for your positive comment ! A warm hello from all the Staff !  See you

title: Very nice
review: Just back from a weeks holiday at the Grand Hotel Liberty in Rive Del Garda. What a lovely old hotel in a great location just a short walk from the centre of Riva. The hotel has a lot of  character and charm and the hotel staff were very helpful  especially the restaurant staff who could not do enough for you. The food was  generally good and as you would expect there was a lot of pasta dishes on the menus but you had a choice of 4 starter and main courses each day and you could normally find something on the menus you liked. The hotel is very clean and our bedroom was very  spacious (room 207) on the second floor but I did hear other guests say that their rooms were on the small side (401). The room had A/C which you need during the summer.The resort of Riva Del Grada is…

title: A comfortable, relaxing week spent,
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your stay and your wonderful review !  Hope to see you here with other friends :)

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stayed at the Liberty in May for a week, lovely hotel very old world in style and not dated as other review suggest, we had an attic room which only had a small round window, wasn't a problem for us as we spend very little time in the room, it was clean sheets and towels changed daily, bed was comfortable enough, continental breakfast each morning was lovely good choice of fruit ect.staff friendly, we were half board so had an evening meal, the food is good fresh and well cooked, finally it's a great location, I would stay again when I return to Riva del Garda.

title: Riva holiday
review: Lovely hotel huge room excellent facilities. Food is diverse and good quality, town of riva was very beautiful. Our guide Laura was was amazing nothing was too much for her. Especially enjoyed trip into the Alps. Will definitely use travel department again. Also very reasonable prices for food and drink.

title: lovely friendly hotel
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your stay and your review ! Hope to see you again with us and in Riva

title: Loved it!
review: our room was small, but clean, beds very comfortable, room safe at no extra charge, towels changed when required. The food was lovely with plenty of choice and waiter service excellent, nothing too much trouble. The outdoor area and pool  plenty of loungers and grassy area to sit/lie on if needed, but as hotel only about  minutes away from the lake it was never too busy.

title: a very nice older tradtitional hotel

title: Make sure of your room
review: My husband and I stayed in this lovely, stylish old hotel for one week earlier this month.  We requested a quiet room away from the road and were allocated room 206 on the second floor of the main building. Although the room was smallish for a twin, it was light with a large window, had high ceilings and adequate wardrobe space. It had a good sized bathroom with full sized bath and hand shower.  At first we puzzled as to how this would work for us as it had no screen or curtain.  It worked fine and the water didn't spray everywhere if used carefully.  The added bonus was another large window from which you could see the mountains whilst lying in the bath.  So we were quite comfortable and content with our room.  Be aware however that there no coffee/tea making facilities in any…

title: Great Hotel
review: I have been at this hotel three times and each time its gets better.  The staff are great and very friendly.  The choice of menu options are very good with every dish prepared very well and presented well.  The waiting staff are good at their jobs especially George Clooney so always in great form.  The location of this hotel is superb near everything in town with great access to two supermarkets across the road.  The rooms were cleaned well and always had clean towels.  While the entertainment  is good the hotel should review it and have acts every night.  I will come back to this hotel next Christmas it is great.

title: Return to Riva
review: Thanks a lot for both review and holiday at the Liberty !  Waiting to see  you again in Christmas  Thanks !

title: 4 Stars not based on rooms!
review: Just complete 3rd visit to Riva and Grand Liberty Hotel.As before really enjoyed  the area with lots to see.Hotel excellent and staff very helpful.Food very good but as it is Italy and you will get Italian Food which was very good.Getting around is easy on the Lake by boat.Rooms not big but how long would you be in your room on holidays.

title: Enjoyed our third holiday with the travel  department to italy
review: Good afternoon,  thanks for your 3rd  visit here and hope to see you for the 4th !  Have a nice day !

title: Stay away from this hotel because of the rooms
review: Grand Hotel Liberty is a difficult one to review. It says it is 4*, reception looks like it is but the bedroom does not look it. Having said that I have just had a wonderful week there! If you want to stay in a very smart hotel where everything is new and shiny then go somewhere else. If you want to stay somewhere sort of 'shabby-chic' 'Agatha Christie-ish' with character then you will like the Liberty.  You have to take into account that Italian hotels do things differently, the rooms are not usually large and, if you are on half-board, you will probably have to make your dinner choices at breakfast time. The hotel is in a fantastic location, just a short walk from everything in Riva. There is a swimming pool and also a Spa with a large choice of massages, manicures etc. We had…

title: Enjoyed
review: I visited Grand hotel liberty in may 2016 with my partner. This was my first holiday abroad. We stayed for 3 nights with Groupon. After reading mixed reviews i was a bit unsure about booking this hotel but we really Enjoyed our selves. I requested not an attic room at time of booking as I had seen on the reviews that there was no view in this room. Check in was easy we were a bit early so we had a drink in the bar.We were on the first floor With a lovely view of the Alps. The room was nice and the safe was free and no deposit. There was a fridge with drinks. The towels were changed everyday. The Breakfast had lots of choice. Cereal toast fruit bacon scrambled egg meats cheese pastrys and cake! The staff were Friendly and helpfull. There is a bar/café open during the day. There…

title: Brilliant Holiday!
review: Stayed in this hotel in May on holiday with Travel Department. Lovely old hotel which could do with a little updating decor-wise. Also, as I don't eat a lot of meat, the menu was a bit limited for me. However, the desserts were delish!  Most of the staff were very friendly and service was very good. Special thanks to the young guy and the lady on Reception who kindly took the time to assist me in the translation of a birthday card.  This hotel is in a great location close to the lake, shops and restaurants.   Riva was beautiful and I had a great time.

title: Disappointing bedrooms.
review: Just back from 7 night stay in this hotel booked via The Travel Department, Dublin. Found everything about the hotel excellent except for quality of bedroom. My bedroom (134) was very small with a very small single bed, poor lighting, view of entrance to an underground car park and a terrible shower! Not good enough for 4* Hotel or reputation of The Travel Department.

title: Super holiday
review: We recently stayed at the Grand Hotel Liberty with the Travel Department. We can not fault the hotel in anyway , the hotel staff were so pleasant especially the restaurant staff and the food was superb especially on the gourmet evening. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Highly recommended

title: Travel Department Holiday
review: We've just spent a week at this lovely hotel  - it was our second stay there and once again, it didn't disappoint.  Yes, the rooms are not luxuriously furnished , but ours was spacious, clean, had a massive bathroom and a lovely view of the pool. The indoor and outdoor swimming areas are both wonderful and it was one of our holiday highlights to have breakfast each morning on the terrace, looking out at the beautiful gardens. I can't comment on dinner as we opted for a breakfast only deal in order to try the towns many restaurants, but breakfast was good.  Without doubt, the hotel's real asset is its staff - courteous, efficient and friendly.  Special mentions for Jacky, the fantastic night manager, as well as all the friendly team at the bar. There's also a a lovely young chap…

title: Delightful experience!
review: Stayed at Grand Hotel Liberty for one week at Easter. It exuded old world charm and was complemented by exceptional staff who attended to everything. The food was excellent and certainly the breakfast was exceptional. To my amazement the morning of our departure at 6.30 a staff member had coffee,tea ,etc available. This certainly exceeded expectation at such an early hour.  I would recommend without hesitation this hotel.

title: Nice Hotel by the lake
review: Stayed here recently for a week as part of a group to Lake Garda with the Travel Department. What a nice change from all the sameness of modern hotels. There was a certain classy elegance  and old world charm throughout the hotel which made for a lovely stay overall. The hotel was spotless, the rooms, bathrooms and public areas. The Dining Room staff certainly enjoy their guests from the Travel Department and lay on all the Italian charm they can muster for their Irish visitors. Keeping the same table for the entire week was a nice idea. The food was good, especially if you like to be a bit adventurous. Rabbit, deer, octopus!! Plenty of more regular options too.  The location of the hotel is very convenient to the centre of Riva, the shops, etc. and to the lake. Our room faced…

title: Great hotel. Great location. Great food. Great staff. Great all round experience
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot and sure to see you again in the future !

title: Lovely holiday around Lake Garda
review: We stayed at this hotel for just one night and the first problem was with the parking. The gate was 'closed' but will open automatically if you drive onto the pavement and up close. I mention this because its not obvious at first and the hotel is close to a one way system so turning around for another go is not so easy! There are also not so many spaces but we got lucky and parked up ok.  The lady on reception was typically Italian, with great customer service skills and a smile!  (She was also able to lend us an adapter for charging our phones)  I've marked this hotel as four stars because although it is very 'Grand' its also a little bit old fashioned in the rooms. The lobby and public areas are excellent but bedrooms could do with an update soon in my opinion. Location is…

title: Beautiful Hotel - Highly Recommended
review: We stayed 3 nights at the Grand Hotel Liberty in April 2016, for my Partner's Birthday. The hotel is just stunning, set in beautiful grounds with authentic Italian décor... just beautiful.  I had asked for an upgrade to a superior balcony room, which was provided. The room was stunning, very spacious and authentic. The only thing I would suggest is some hot drink/tea making facilities, but a fridge mini bar was provided (at a cost, of course). The balcony was lovely and nice to sit out and watch the sunset with views of the mountains. The bathroom was quite small, especially the shower... but had all the amenities needed.  The spa was beautiful and access was unlimited and free of charge which was great. Breakfast also included and good selection of hot and cold foods, all…

title: A lovely holiday in Lake Garda
review: When the Airport coach pulled up to the door of the Grand Hotel Liberty we heard one of the other passengers remark "now that's a real hotel".  That sums it up.  The year of opening/building was 1910 going by the marble inlay at the entrance and the atmosphere in the public spaces is one of old-world charm.  Check-in was extremely efficient and we were on our way to our room within minutes.  We had a standard room on the second floor and were very happy with it.  Décor in the rooms is a little tired but I understand that they are due to be redecorated shortly.     Food was excellent.   We stuck with the Italian menu which was terrific but it is possible to order other options (steak and chips etc.) if that does not suit.  The dining room staff went out of their way to ensure…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: We had half board here and the food was fantastic!  Everything you could want for breakfast.  Good menu selection for evening meal & served by very friendly staff.  Very well located.  Only downside was the old fashioned bedroom.  We had paid extra for an upgraded room but was very disappointed.  We were on the 2nd floor but the Wi-fi reception was not good there.   Lovely gardens including a swimming pool outside. Heated swimming pool inside also.   Very good value.

title: Best hotel in Riva del Garda
review: A fantastic place! We spent 7 nights in this  comfortable hotel in March 2016. The hotel is situated in a fascinating place, 5 minutes walk from the lake. A big supermarket is right behind the corner, old city center is 10 minutes walk. Waterfall is  10 minutes by car. The hotel itself is rather old, and needs some renovation to be done. Rooms are comfortable and well cleaned. Breakfast is rich, stuff very friendly and pleasing. We traveled with a 1,5 son, who was the only child in the hotel for a few days, everybody in the hotel tried to help him, it was really nice. As an advantage there is playing room for children on the 1st floor.  Most visitors that time were elderly people, but i' m sure young people would like it too. Spa is nice, most of all we liked saunas (there were…

title: Nice Old Fashion Place
review: We went for a week in March 2016.Hotel in good location.Bedrooms need updating, carpets and Bed covers very worn.Breakfast was very good but the dinner menu could do with an option for European food, not just Italian.Our first room on the second floor was very small and hot so we paid a little extra to upgrade and got a room with a terrace on the first floor which was very nice. The option to maybe rent a Kettle for making Tea Coffee would be very nice too.

title: 2 days of relax
review: Good afternoon,  thanks for your review !  We will refurbish the rooms next winter, regarding the food I am sorry to read that, all our Guest are happy and we do a mediterranean / international cousine, not only an italian. Of course we are in Italy and we also make some Italian food to let our Guest try them  Thanks a lot anyway and see you again !

title: Weekend at Lake Garda
review: We booked originally 3 nights, but extended then to 4 since the location is very convenient to visit different cities around. We went to Verona and Innsbruck (Austria) from there and came back the same day ... some friends went to Venice too. The breakfast was good, the WiFi ok, and the parking was tight but it worked. The SPA was awesome. If you go to Riva del Garda, you have to eat at the Acetaia Restaurant ... absolutely awesome.

title: Great hotel with character! Spa, Location & Food were excellent
review: Grand liberty hotel has a perfect location in Riva (Lake Garda) town. Me & my mother went here with Traveldepartment tours from Ireland last week. Considering the price of the holiday, I expected an average enough hotel & instead we got this gem. The hotel inside, has a charming 'grande' style (think of a opulent Romeo & Juliet era). Our room (which was an upgraded room - not basic room) was of equal character with the high ceilings & regal décor. Room size was medium/large,with had a huge balcony overlooking the pre-alps - really stunning. The room was much better than the photos online (room no 108). The hotel food & waiters were again above expectation. We had 3 course Italian Cuisine meals for dinner & it was always fresh food,stunning sauces & great choices. The dining…

review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your 5 star review ! Appreciate that you enjoyed your stay and see you again :)

title: Lovely Hotel
review: Just back from a 5 night stay booked through Travel  Department. Before going, I checked out the website for this hotel and to be honest, I was a bit wary as the photos weren't great. However, the photos actually don't do this lovely hotel justice. This hotel is absolutely spotless. The standard of cleanliness is second to none. The staff in all areas are lovely and extremely friendly without being intrusive. We were given a large room on the 3rd floor, the ensuite had an amazing shower with very hot water. The breakfast buffet was one of if not THE best continental buffets I have seen in a European hotel. title: Lakeside rooms have the best views
review: Lovely hotel, with very warm and friendly staff.  It's an old style hotel, right in the centre of Riva del Garda.  The food is very good, with fruit, cereal, breads, pastries for breakfast and couple of choices for starters/main/dessert at night time.  Nice bar with live entertainment on Sunday night.

title: Rest Assured
review: Like many of the previous reviewers we were part of a Travel Department organised party. Our stay was over the New Year period and, without repeating all the points made previously, I must say that we had a very pleasant stay in this lovely period hotel. Of course it has its shortcomings but, if all the negatives noted by other reviewers were rectified, the room charges would certainly increase. The reception staff were a bit stuffy. Otheewise, we had a pleasant room on 2nd floor at back of the house, the food was very good (occasionally spectacular), the company was good and the location, within a short walk of the lake, was perfect. There is a small gym (free) and an indoor pool (pay €15). With the exception of one smart a#s, the waiters were pleasant and helpful. Wifi around…

title: Christmas in hotel liberty
review: This was our 2nd stay in the liberty. The staff are very friendly. The hotel has an old world charm about it. We had a beautiful old fashioned spotless  room at the front of the hotel with a fantastic view of the dolomites. The location is perfect for exploring Riva and the Lake.  The only let down was the food was not great. A bit hit and miss. We will definitely stay there again but on a half board basis.

title: Old time elegance in the Grand Hotel Liberty(on budget prices)
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your holiday ! Sorry about the food, very strange because everyone here is happy about that, and we give all choices for each course. Try again next time and I am sure you will like it !

title: Second Visit
review: 6 members of the family went with the travel Depth to the Hotel Liberty for the Xmas break ,The holiday exceeded our expectations .The hotel liberty is well situated near the lake and town ,with many beautiful walks in the area .The hotel room was nice with a great view of the alps and the facilities in the hotel are excellent ,they have a great spa facility and beauty salon and a nice bar area with good prices ,for those who like Irish bars there is one across the road from the hotel.The food was excellent and the Traditional Christmas lunch was a wonderful experience.The dinner is waitress service and I much preferred it to the usual buffet style meal, the staff were friendly and helpful and did all they could to make the dining experience a good one a.The 3 trips included on…

title: Fantastic location, awful bed
review: Okay, hotel location is fabulous. Central to the town, walking distance to everything. Rooms are a little tired. We had an economy room, anattic room with a high window. We had to stand on a chair to see out, but we were on a deal so we were prepared for a lower standard.  The room decor is dated and the shower screen is inadequate resulting in a waterlogged floor each time you use the shower. None of that really mattered however, but the bed was horrible.  Nasty pillows, hard mattress, very uncomfortable. That really was the worst thing.  The staff were great, the Spa is brilliant. All let down by appalling beds. Food was ok, breakfast a little tedious but ok. Toaster was rubbish, coffee was gorgeous. Apparently they are due a refurbishment programme. This hotel will be…

title: Can Recommend this hotel
review: We stayed for 7 nights on a half-board basis as part of a tour group. The hotel is well located, an easy walk to the town centre and the lake shore. Hotel facilities are very good – indoor & outdoor swimming pools, spa, nice café/bar, dining room with nice terrace overlooking the garden/pool area. The free Wifi worked well.  Staff are generally friendly and helpful and most have a reasonable command of English.  Bedrooms are fairly basic but adequate. We switched from room 303, an attic room with a small circular window – which made the room gloomy even at the brightest part of the day. Our room 116 was smaller but a lot brighter (see photos). Housekeeping was good – clean towels daily & our bed-linen was changed a couple of times during our stay. The only real problem was the…

title: Seventh visit, just as good as the first.
review: Our 2 weeks in September, followed our 1 week in May. The weather was unusually the worst we have ever had, rain on most of our 14 days, storms even blew some trees down in the park near the lake, but we love this hotel so much it didn't spoil our holiday.  The staff are wonderful, so attentive and friendly, we feel that we are visiting friends from the moment we arrive. George was always on hand for advice if there was something on the menu that we didn't understand and to offer an alternative if there was anything we didn't think we would like. title: Grand Hotel Liberty, Lake Garda
review: My husband and I stayed in the Grand Hotel Liberty in Riva del Garda from Friday 18th to Monday 21st September 2015. We had been to Lake Garda on a number of occasions previously however we had not been to Riva before and were apprehensive about what we would find.  We hired a car and drove from Milan Bergamo Airport. I think it took about 2 hours to reach the hotel, but what a fantastic drive through the mountains until we reached Riva!!! Amazing!!!  We arrived at the hotel and found ample parking to the side of the hotel. The carpark  had a locked gate which opened with a code so we knew that we wouldn't have to worry about the car during our stay.  The hotel itself is beautiful and has a very stylish entrance. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming and directed us to…

title: Wonderful

The pool area was fab and the spa was really nice too.. title: Good times

title: Perfect location & Great Staff
review: The hotel was perfectly located... Central and only a few minutes walk from the lake. Our room was spacious and with a view... Windows were small. title: Fading Elegance

title: Friendliest staff ever!
review: Having stayed here last year for a week half board, we decided to return this year for a fortnight to soak up this beautiful part of the world, although this year booking B&B so we had the option to eat out at the plethora of restaurants in the town. Whilst some reviews on here class the rooms as dated, my opinion is that they have character which is in keeping with the building - lovely airy high ceilings, air-conditioned (you need to ask for it to be turned on though), nicely cleaned with beds made up with care and attention and a great shower! But the two main reasons we returned here were the Grand Liberty's location and staff. It's close proximity to the old town (museum, harbour, shops, restaurants) and lake 'beach' is ideal - literally a 5 minute walk.  It might be…

review: Just back after spending a week in the Grand Hotel Liberty. We were a party of four and all agreed we will be back again. Breakfast staff were very pleasant and breakfast itself is very nice and can be taken on the covered veranda, The hotel is in a great location. WiFi was slow and I would strongly recommend NOT logging in by using e-mail or social media, as…

We were given room number 131 which I think was a disabled room.  We felt fortunate to have a rather large bathroom with plenty of room.  We also had a balcony on which we could sit. A couple of things to note are that the only available mirror was above the sink in the bathroom.  It would be useful to have a mirror in the bedroom as well but this didn't prove to be too much of a problem.  The air conditioning was not automatically on in the room and we found it…

title: Our Favourite Place
review: Just stayed for the sixth time and every year it gets better.  The improvement this year was the food.  Chef delighted us with some wonderful tasty meals, our favourites being the soups and pasta dishes.  As ever the staff in Reception, Restaurant, Bar and Housekeeping were welcoming, friendly and efficient.  Is it any wonder that this is our favourite hotel? title: Charming historic Jugend hotel in superb location, goodbreakfast, free in/outdoor pool, very weak Wifi, limited parking
review: Just returned from Riva Del Garda and stayed for a week at this hotel. Where do I start ! What a fantastic place. This Hotel has character by the bucket full, the main hotel building dates back to 1910 in the Victorian age and has been converted from an Austrian Villa of the time. Wow, it is beautiful !! However, anyone expecting to get ultra-modern facilities will be disappointed, whilst the rooms are kept very clean by the daily housekeeping, the actual facilities need looking into. We stayed in room no. 110 (Standard Twin/Double) which was a perfectly acceptable room to stay for a week, albeit the shower-room is only sufficient for one person at a time (tiny). If you want to charge your mobile/tablet actually, anything, you will have to use the plug socket in the shower-room…

review: We stayed here as part of a Travel Department holiday. We were an adult family of 3 so had 1 double and a single room. Both were shabby but clean. The window was almost too high up to see through and we were unable to open it, which was a problem because in spite of the high temperature the air conditioning was not available until June! The tv was situated high up on the wall and could not be switched off with the remote. Hence it was not used because the balancing act required to turn the tv off was too difficult. The double room luckily had opening windows to allow for some cooler air but it meant we had to put up with the external noise. Lots of…

Food was good in the  dining room but wine choice was limited.  Location to everything is great,walking to everything only…

title: Well located hotel, good for those on gluten free diet.

We found a very quiet roof terrace and sat up there most late afternoons reading and taking in the views of the mountains. Riva itself was lovely. There was plenty to do and with the hotel being less…

title: Old school service. Health spa wonderful.
review: We stayed for two nights. Room was ok - bed comfy but only two pillows, so we had to ask for more. Nice garden and pool area and a two minute walk from Lake and shops. Great week.

title: Good Swimming Pool and Crap Wifi!
review: Italy is a third world country when it comes to wifi! I've stayed in Mexican villages with better wifi than Milan. This hotel is rather past it's best by date, some 40 or 50 years past! The morning following our arrival were shown two other rooms which were little better so we chose not to undergo the disruption of moving. The furniture was…

Only down side to the spa was that the robes cost 15 euros each and if you wanted a clean one over the week you had to pay another 15…

title: 10 days stay at the Grand Liberty
review: Spent 10 fantastic days at the Hotel Grand Liberty, Lake Garda recently.  We stayed in room 126, and luckily and a nice little surprise, it had a balcony (not many rooms in this hotel have balconies).  The decoration is a little dated but other than that it was roomy and well equipped with a flat screen TV and clean.  It had a mini bar which was handy and stocked each night if necessary.  The air con was controlled by reception who had the sense to turn it off when it was not quite so hot.  Dining experience was also very good, the food was well presented and very tasty, the only complaint here is they tended to rush you through the course's.  Drinks in the bar were reasonably priced, but you could always go to the nearby supermarket and buy very cheap drinks - for example,…

review: Travelled to Riva Del Garda with my wife as part of a Travel Department package, although we chose extras in pool side bedroom with air conditioning. Thus we were allocated a room in the Grand Hotel Liberty. Hotel staff were friendly, helpful and very interactive. Offering advice and responding to conversation positively. Breakfast option including cooked, cold and cereal with wide fruit selection. Bar, lounge, covered and uncovered deck seating. Private external pool facility and internal pool and spa facility. Closely sited to shopping centre or the town square where entertainment is free while you eat or…

title: Great old fashioned hotel
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for all ! Just remind for who is reading that we give always our 100% and the hotel is open all year round !

title: G Roberts
review: Stayed at this hotel on a Travel Department holiday. Reception staff were always very pleasant and helpful. Restaurant staff were excellent and great fun. Food was excellent. Loads of places to sit and relax, bar area and outdoor bar area were very pleasant places to hang out. The pool was perfect.

title: Good old hotel
review: Very beautiful hotel. Excellent location at the city center. The staff is helpful and friendly. They are ready to solve any issue. Free private parking. - Poor breakfast and Centralized AC. You need to call to the reception and ask to switch it on or off.

title: Good holiday at Grand Liberty apart from cell like bedroom
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your stay ! Hope to see you again and we will take notes about your comments  Have a nice day

title: Old World Charm
review: I travelled with the Travel Department and was very happy with the organisation of this trip. The Guide, Annalisa was most informative and helpful.  My friend and I had single rooms on the ground floor and they really should not be used for guests at this hotel.  They are small, dark and overlook a car park.The corridor carpet leading to these rooms should be replaced as it is threadbare, I spent as little time as possible in the room as it was so depressing.  We were offered a double room to share when we complained but no single rooms were on offer.  I would love to return to this hotel but would not consider returning unless I could be assured of a better room.  I feel people who request a single room in many hotels are treated as second class citizens. Apart from the…

title: Old Fashioned Appreciation of Patrons
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for  your stay ! Regarding the rooms we are going to refurbish them in the next years, will update you all trough website or newsletter  Thanks !

title: We were left like flowers in the Attic!
review: My daughter-in-law and I had a girl's night away to Riva del Garda.  The hotel boasts a very large indoor pool with sauna and steam room; which was perfect for a cold two days in January.  Our room was on the East side with a grand view of the mountains.  Buffet breakfast was expansive and tasty.  The hotel's location is perfect to walk to into town and see the beauty of the lake.  It was a beautiful Italian hotel with old-world charm.

title: Old world charm of hotel Liberty
review: Lovely hotel with good standard of cleanliness. Our room was more of a salon with a huge balcony overlooking the street with the mountains to the right. Quiet at night with steel shutters electronically controlled to keep out the light in the mornings. Hotel was beautifully furnished in a grand style with a modern bar area. Staff were friendly and helpful - thought that it was a bit much to have to pay 30 euros, non-returnable, to hire bathrobes and towels in order to use the outdoor pool. Pool was a relaxed, well maintained area, not really suitable for young children as there was no children's pool, but this suited us; however the water was freezing and could have done with a mild heating to take the chill off! Breakfast was fine - have had better in German hotels - but there…

title: beautiful place to stay
review: I was going through some reviews and have seen a quite derogatory one for this place by a lady earlier in the year. We stayed here as part of a group, all the staff were kind courteous and friendly. Not just one or two, but all of them! The matre' D who called himself Georgio Clooney was excellent as was all his waiting staff. Seemed a trek, but once inside was well worth the walk. Twin floored room with every amenity.…

title: One week in The Liberty
review: We stayed in GH Liberty early June 14. We were part of group with the Travel Dept and enjoyed our stay and holiday immensely. The pluses are 1. superb location beside the shops/restaurants 2. beautiful town with fantastic restaurants like Hotel Sole for lunch by the lake and Leon Dor 3. fantastic staff especially Bruno in the restaurant 4. escorted trips to Venice and Verona and trip around the lake were brilliant.5 Evening meals were really good although choice was limited some evenings.6 close to Flora ice cream parlours which are the best I have ever been to.Minuses were 1. room no 111 a bit small for 4^ hotel but spotlessly clean 2. not many 26 approx sun loungers by the pool which is very small 3 breakfast is adequate but limited choice of hot food and fresh fruit.4. the…

title: When quaint becomes outdated..but still value if not fussy
review: Liberty  looks....well a faded Grand, has fine rooms for public view and excellent Spa but the bedrooms are very dated, something  out of the 60's might describe unless you get a Superior room in the older part at the front. The staff are very attentive and make up for the rest but the food is a bit  less than grand, and while served in a nice dining room and appearing to offer good choice the menu is a bit bland and  preparation is not top science here. Location is great, pool outside lovely and the internal spa pool good with small but good gym.  With the town on the doorstep with…
