review: Don't stay at this Hotel if you are expecting a Four Star stay.Yes,some aspects of the Hotel are approaching this level but it's a bit like the "Curate's egg" a mixture of good and bad.The first room we were given was small and dark with hardly enough room to swing a very small cat in  ..........(1*room) After two nights of fitful sleep we were moved to a much better room,bright and with the amount of space one should expect in a Hotel claiming this standard ...(3* room).As a matter of interest if you are a tall person 6 feet or more be warned the beds are very narrow and small.The Breakfast and Evening meal are adequate and in general the staff were helpful but not very enthusiastic in giving advice (I only found out the day we were leaving ..from an other guest ...that special…

review: Good afternoon,  thanks a lot for your stay ! A small comment of wines, if you like a service, like all over the world, of course there is a price. title: great place to stay
review: Went with the travel department,the dining room staff are excellent,so nice but not over the top ,great craic.The tall bar man  was very good,there was one man on reception very nice,unfortunately the females reception staff did the hotel a disservice. title: Excellent Hotel
review: Had a wonderful stay at the Grand Hotel Liberty, the hotel was lovely, the staff were exceptionally courteous and helpful.  We were very fortunate with our rooms, I use the plural as our accommodation consisted of a very large room which was a sitting/dining room with enormous window with doors opening to a balcony, the view was delightful.  Stairs leading from this room led to the large bedroom with en suite bathroom, consisting of two wash hand basins, toilet, bidet and Jacuzzi with an overhead shower.  The Jacuzzi had very powerful jets and was extremely relaxing.  The rooms were spotlessly clean.  The indoor pool is lovely and the spa had much to offer.  On hot days, it was nice to relax by the outdoor pool.  The situation of the hotel was perfect as it’s just a short walk…

title: Ok.
review: Just back from a wonderful walking holiday in Lake Garda, organised by the Travel Department and the group of 12 were based at the Grand Hotel Liberty for the week. I highly recommend this lovely old world hotel, which had high ceilings and old architecture combined with modern needs eg free wifi. Lovely warm welcome on arrival, quick check in and a nice clean room, which was basic but had air conditioning, TV with over 80 channels, a fridge and nice bathroom with large bath and good water pressure. The room was located in the new part of the hotel but was very quiet and although it was small I was out all day taking in the fantastic walking routes around Lake Garda and spent little time in the room. The staff were friendly and could not have been more helpful, accommodating all…

Breakfast was excellent, coffee, bread, cheeses, eggs and much more. Only one thing to complain. The room on the top floor. I think there were some serious problems with ventilation. I would not recommend to stay there longer times (we where 2 nights). This was the only hotel in out 6 day trip that had this bad air in the room (and this was the most expencive hotel that we stayed in).

title: superb
review: I agree  totally with the review of March 6th. Just returned from a wonderful week in GHL today. The restaurant staff are second to none. They could not do enough for you and are so dedicated to giving you a wonderful, unforgettable time in their hotel. I agree, the food is definitely not 5 star but the service definitely is. The staff that service the bedrooms too are wonderful and do a super job daily. We would have no hesitation whatsoever recommending the GHL to all. We travelled with the amazing Travel Department who are unbeatable in terms of quality and value.

Thanks a lot

title: Do not be put off the Grand Hotel Liberty, Riva del Garda
review: Where does one start. Just returned from a week at this Hotel. Would have loved to have seen it in its past. A beautiful 1910 mansion changed into a lovely modern hotel with all the latest decor and swimming pools and fitness centre although we did not use these facilities. High ceilings and large rooms. Our bedroom was on the third (top) floor with its high beamed ceilings and was the servants quarters in days long ago. Fitted out with modern shower room with WC, Shower, basin and bidet.  The bedroom, a twin, was  large with more than enough  wardrobe and drawer space. A small safe and a minibar fridge, restocked each day as used. Beds very confortable with spare pillows and linen. Good sized lift serving all floors including the basement for the indoor swimming pool      and…

title: Staying in Grand Hotel, Liberty, Riva del Garda.
review: I have stayed in the Grand Hotel, Liberty, Riva del Garda and found the staff lovely and helpful, the hotel is beautiful and set in a wonderfully beautiful town of Riva del Garda.  While in the Liberty, I have stayed in the hotel as a single traveler, as well as staying with family, and the staff have always been very helpful! I would have no problem recommending the hotel to anyone!   Ashleigh. Xxx

title: I'll be back.
review: Just spent a week for new year in The Grand Hotel Liberty in  Riva Lake Garda. Cant praise this hotel highly enough. Old world charme and excelent service from the hotel staff who are just fantastic. We went with The Travel Department tour group from dublin. Both myself and my husband traveled with my daughter and two grand children age twelve and four. From the moment we arrived we were treated like old friends specialy by the resturant [dinning room ]staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they totaly spoiled our youngest grandchild  for the week. I  would like to thank George and Antonio and Allie and the lovely waitress  [dident get her name] for looking after us all week for breakfast and dinner. The hotel has a lovely pool and a great playroom for children as well…

title: Friendly service, good hotel, shame about the parking
review: Had a nice stay here. It's an old traditional hotel, with an excellent location right in the heart of Riva. Free wifi.  Weird: the shower is really good and powerful, but it's hand held and there's no shower curtain. So you have to prefer baths to showers.  Pros: location, the breakfast was good, the staff were very friendly and helpful, there's free wifi, beds are comfy, flat screen TVs with English channels  Cons: the parking. It was full when we arrived at 5pm on a Saturday evening. We had to park a ten minute walk away in an unsecure car park. The reception assured us it was safe, and we didn't have any problems, but it was a bit annoying. The hotel could definitely have got 30% more cars in the car park if they managed it properly. The receptionist said that Italians like…

title: Terrible food
review: Good evening,  thanks a lot for your stay, sometime the car park can be full on saturdays, it's true that now we are not ready to make big spending in the hotel and also is not easy to find a good place where to make more parking, if not destroying the front gardens of the house.  Thanks a lot

title: Great Holiday!
review: This is an OK hotel. It's not 4 star (as it claims) but it's not far off it. There's a genteel elegance about the older part of the hotel where we stayed and it provides a comfortable place to rest your head. But then you get to the dining room and this is nowhere near 4 star. We were staying on a half board package but is it really necessary for us to order our evening meal at breakfast? And what choices! Ham and Russian Salad (it was tinned - I remember it from childhood), Turkey Burger were the most memorable (for the wrong reasons). On two occasions we had to check back with the menu to find out what we'd eaten. Eventually we just gave up and went out to eat.

title: Pity about the food
review: Good evening,  thanks a lot for your stay, however I cannot of course confirm your point of view, we are a 4 star hotel in every part you see and about the food really sorry about you didn't like it because if you can read nearly all our comments are all very good about the kitchen. Ordering in the morning instead of the evening is only to make our service quicker because many people don't like to wait too much for eating. We are always available to give different choices about the food, and finally I cannot accept 2 rating only for the food problem.  Thanks a lot

title: Good place to explore lake Garda
review: I have just returned home after spending 5 nights at the Grand Liberty Hotel in Riva del Garda, Italy. My trip was short however I certainly enjoyed my stay at this lovely old hotel.  The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. When I entered the bedroom at first I got a shock because it was so small and dark, it had a tidy window  I could view only the sky, I couldn't find the light switches as they were situated low to the ground.  The furniture was very dark 1960's style with dark panelling,  however the room  did have a  big flat screen TV  which was a bonus! The bed was comfortable and I slept well throughout my holiday, I had requested a quiet room and it certainly was that.  I decided that I would not complain as I was staying less than a week and I was not sharing …

title: Room without a view
review: This is a first. I have stayed in many hotels, both for business and pleasure. All had windows with a view of some nature. Photo attached shows our view of the sky only!! Room faults: 1. Only 1 bedside locker and 1 bedside lamp. 2. Wardrobes totally dishevelled and in a darkened of the room. 3. Décor of the room was 1960's and shabby. 4. Bathroom door stuck on floor tiles. 5. Shower area a disaster and without handle to lever yourself out of the high-rimmed bath. 6. Cheapest and tiniest toiletries imaginable 7. No place to hang towels 8. Sheets falling off the bed  These rooms should not be offered in a 3 or 4 star hotel... or indeed, in view of the lack of windows, they don't seem fit for a prison.  The receptionists were cold and unfriendly, whereas the dining room staff were…

title: Thank you Grand Hotel Liberty
review: Good afternoon,  really sorry about reading your review !  Our attic rooms are sold with description that there is no view from the room, so I am sorry about your disappoint about that. Anyway why you didn't ask a room change or upgrade ? We have 4 different type of room in the hotel, and if we are not fully booked, we can always change the room if the Guest didn't like.  Thanks a lot

title: Awful attic rooms
review: I have just returned from a fabulous week at the Grand Hotel Liberty in Riva Del Garda, Italy. My holiday was greatly enhanced by the hotel staff who were helpful and friendly at all times and whatever the situation. Special mentions to George and Bruno in the restaurant who were not only friendly and highly amusing but also able to anticipate their guests needs effortlessly. I was in a beautifully decorated third floor room which was also very spacious and quiet, the bathroom seemed to have been refitted recently, both were kept spotlessly clean at all times. There was a huge choice of food at breakfast, hot, cold, British, Continental and as much good strong Italian coffee as you wanted or needed. Evening meals were varied and I'm sure that even the fussiest of eaters would…

title: Very Nice Hotel, Best Value for Money
review: Good afternoon and thanks for your stay and your review !  I am sure our Staff will be happy to read your comment, we really hope to see you again in the future and we wish you a good day  Thanks

title: Stay October 2013
review: The attic rooms that I and my friends were given in this Hotel were like prison cells - This is a 4 star hotel - and was sold to us as such.  The window was way above our heads and all we could see was the sky!  We had no idea what it was like outside.......... These rooms may have been acceptable in the past, but should no longer be sold as 4 star quality.  The shower screen was about a foot wide which meant that, we the lucky ones who could stand up in our bath!!! sprayed water all over the bathroom.  Whoever showered second waded through an inch of water - all our toiletries were soaked the first day. The saving grace was the wonderful dining room service - such really nice, helpful and amusing waiters.

title: Grand Experience
review: We have just returned from a week's stay at this hotel.  We were in a group who had flown from Edinburgh with the Travel Department.  We had looked at previous reviews of the hotel and had high expectations and we were not disappointed.  The staff were amazing, could not do enough for you.  The food was really good with 4 choices for each course.  Some evenings I just wanted a light starter and was assured this was no problem and I had melon.  The food was also beautifully presented.  The staff are so professional and obviously enjoy what they do.  If we are able to visit this area again then we will definitely stay at this hotel again.  It certainly was a "Grand Experience"

title: Nice old hotel with character
review: Good afternoon,  thanks a million for your holiday with us ! We cannot wait to see you again in our hotel, so please go and book your next holiday !  We have package together with Travel Department every time !  Thanks a lot !

title: October holiday
review: Outside of hotel is lovely. Inside is nice lobby and great coffee bar with friendly staff and comfortable seating.   The location is great for a walk around the town with lots to see and do within walking distance  Food is great  The spa and swimming pool are very relaxing with an exclusive feel.   Room was a bit dark and gloomy had the feel like it was an old convent  Fridge in room was handy to keep drinks cool

title: Lovely trip
review: Spent a relaxing week at Grand Hotel Liberty and we were very happy with the hotel and the facilities. Our room was a split level room in an annex at the rear of the main building. There was a spacious lounge with a comfortable seating area, mini bar & large T.V. The bedroom and bathroom were on a mezzanine level above, reached by a small staircase. The bed was very comfortable, and there was an additional T.V. on the upper level. The bathroom had a Jacuzzi type bath we had a laugh trying. The room could use a make over but all in all it was o.k. Staff were always courteous and polite. Recommend the first class indoor pool and spa area. Limited menu for evening meals but the food was excellent. Nice bar area for drinks, teas, coffees and snacks.  Hotel is very handy for the town…

title: Another Wonderful holiday in Grand Hotel Liberty
review: I have just returned from a wonderful two week stay in the Grand Hotel Liberty, Riva. I travelled with my parents who are both 'Golden Olides' ( but goodies! ), and we all agreed that the hotel was a marvelous as ever. We have become regular visitors to this hotel in September each year and the reason we keep going back is because the hotel is just so good. My mother is Disabled and has walking diffuculites, for which she uses a rollator and it is hard to find a resort and hotel that suits her needs. I would advise anyone who has someone with a disability to seriously consider both this hotel and the resort of Riva Del Garda as a potential holiday destination.The hotel is no more than a 10 minute walk from the front door of the hotel to the centre of the resort so it's in a…

The restaurant is very good and the staff excellent always a smile for every one. Breakfast is…

title: Great location, good service, not great rooms
